metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8831 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The saa7164_bus_get function in drivers/media/pci/saa7164/saa7164-bus.c inthe Linux kernel through 4.11.5 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact by changing a certain sequence-number value, aka a "double fetch"vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-96-generic - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-lowlatency - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-96-generic - 4.4.0-96.119
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1074.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1076-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1076.81
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1035-aws - 4.4.0-1035.44
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1031-gke - 4.4.0-1031.31
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1031-gke - 4.4.0-1031.31
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-96.119').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.82').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.81').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1035.44').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1031.31').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
